intro: Lappula redowskii var. desertorum, commonly known as desert lappula, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its environment.
